intro: Rhodiola prainii, commonly known as the Himalayan rhodiola, is a perennial flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant thrives in cold, arid environments and is adapted to survive in extreme conditions. It is often found in rocky areas and alpine meadows at elevations ranging from 3,000 to 5,000 meters. Rhodiola prainii is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional medicine for its purported adaptogenic and antioxidant effects.
